qas.question: From what language did Catalan come?
In what area did Catalan develop?
When did Catalan develop in the Eastern Pyrenees?
When was Catalan's Golden Age as a dominant language?
What year started the decline of Catalan as a main language?

context: Catalan evolved from <a0_0>Vulgar Latin<a0_0/> around the <a1_0>eastern Pyrenees<a1_0/> in the <a2_0>9th century<a2_0/>. During the <a3_0>Low Middle Ages<a3_0/> it saw a golden age as the literary and dominant language of the Crown of Aragon, and was widely used all over the Mediterranean. The union of Aragon with the other territories of Spain in <a4_0>1479<a4_0/> marked the start of the decline of the language. In 1659 Spain ceded Northern Catalonia to France, and Catalan was banned in both states in the early 18th century. 19th-century Spain saw a Catalan literary revival, which culminated in the 1913 orthographic standardization, and the officialization of the language during the Second Spanish Republic (1931–39). However, the Francoist dictatorship (1939–75) banned the language again.
